Title.evidence: Intraoperative Dexmedetomidine and Postoperative Delirium: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomized to receive either dexmedetomidine (0.5 µg/kg/h) or saline placebo

Participants.evidence: elderly patients (>68 years) undergoing major elective noncardiac surgery

Intervention.evidence: randomized to receive either dexmedetomidine (0.5 µg/kg/h) or saline placebo

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was postoperative delirium, assessed daily.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was computer-generated, with allocation concealed using sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding included patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 404 patients were randomized (202 to dexmedetomidine, 202 to placebo); Recruitment occurred from February 2008 to May 2014.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Postoperative delirium incidence was similar between groups (12.2% dexmedetomidine vs 11.4% placebo, P = .94).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were similar across groups.
